channel.title: Finally!
channel.description:
[quote="yakman"]british people here sign this petition to get the Prime Minister to apologize for the prosecution of Alan Turing that led to his untimely death. http://petitions.number10.gov.uk/turing/[/quote] kay... so computer nerds who like really super old stuff would like this guy http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/technology/8226509.stm http://news.bbc.co.uk/local/manchester/hi/people_and_places/religion_and_ethics/newsid_8209000/8209978.stm Alan Turing!!! Great man. But err
In 1952 Turing was prosecuted under the gross indecency act after admitting to a sexual relationship with a man. Two years later he killed himself. Alan Turing was given experimental chemical castration as a "treatment" and his security privileges were removed, meaning he could not continue work for the UK Government Communications Headquarters (GCHQ).

item.title: Finally!
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:15, topic:299277”]petitions work
http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page20571

Gordon Brown:

So on behalf of the British government, and all those who live freely thanks to Alan’s work I am very proud to say: we’re sorry, you deserved so much better.

I wonder how the homophobic moparisthebest feels about a gay man helping found the very subject he has a degree in.[/quote]

yeah… Mopar get over here and discuss this “vague” topic

Read full topic

item.title: Finally!
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:13, topic:299277”]He helped us win the war so of course he was epic.

Anyways I don’t think an apology from our dirty fat one-eyed Scottish dickhead Prime-Minister is going to be at all sincere therefore it is unnecessary. He has tributes around the country, he’s been appreciated and his persecution and suicide were unfortunate, but he has been recognised (if not officially) as being a key figure in the code breaking so a post-death Knighthood is pointless.[/quote]

Another brit fag! But anyway at least we can all agree he was an epic man!

Read full topic

item.title: Finally!
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

He helped us win the war so of course he was epic.

Anyways I don’t think an apology from our dirty fat one-eyed Scottish dickhead Prime-Minister is going to be at all sincere therefore it is unnecessary. He has tributes around the country, he’s been appreciated and his persecution and suicide were unfortunate, but he has been recognised (if not officially) as being a key figure in the code breaking so a post-death Knighthood is pointless.

item.title: Finally!
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

newbiehacker:

I don’t believe in life after death, the point is the principle, although I’m sure you probably don’t know what principles are.

Yea sure, just play it on the man.

EDIT: what I was trying to do here, was spark a little debate about the apologies to dead people. I didn’t say I’m against it or anything, altough it may seem so if you read my post.

Read full topic

item.title: Finally!
item.dc:creator: @atrox atrox_
item.description:
@atrox wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:9, topic:299277”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=395616.msg2940262#msg2940262 date=1251830844]
I know it was against the law, but I see no point in castrating a gay guy.

british people here sign this petition to get the Prime Minister to apologize for the prosecution of Alan Turing that led to his untimely death.

http://petitions.number10.gov.uk/turing/

What I wonder here is why you care. I always thought you didn’t believe in a life after death? Why apologize to a dead guy?
[/quote]

I’ll answer your question with a video if thats alright.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oT8HYGFwspM[/quote]
I’m surprised it wasn’t a wikipedia article

Read full topic

What I wonder here is why you care. I always thought you didn’t believe in a life after death? Why apologize to a dead guy?[/quote]

I don’t believe in life after death, the point is the principle, although I’m sure you probably don’t know what principles are.

item.title: Finally!
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:5, topic:299277”][quote author=bootnecklad link=topic=395616.msg2940199#msg2940199 date=1251824692]

Why would you castrate a homosexual? Were they afraid he made another man pregnant?

It was illegal to be a homosexual, so he was punished.
[/quote]
Should we castrate you just because you download stuff illegal?

No, even if it was a crime the punishment should be fairer.[/quote]
Fuck how did you know?! But on another note at the time it was against the law and that was the done thing to happen back then. Its kinda like saying well, the murderer did say sorry so we wont give you the death sentence for killing & torturing 180 people.

[quote=“yakman, post:6, topic:299277”]british people here sign this petition to get the Prime Minister to apologize for the prosecution of Alan Turing that led to his untimely death.

http://petitions.number10.gov.uk/turing/[/quote]

Thanks Yakmanm, was going to put that in the first post.
